byline.contributor: Alan Rappeport contributed reporting from Waterloo, Iowa.
byline.original: By PATRICK HEALY and YAMICHE ALCINDOR

abstract: Iowan Democrats are showing far more enthusiasm for Bernie Sanders than Hillary Clinton, causing anxious Clinton campaign to reassess situation; polls show Sanders surging ahead, prompting Clinton and aides to increase focus on him and determine how to undercut his high ratings.
lead_paragraph: With voters mobbing Mr. Sanders at events in the state, exposing a disparity in passion for the two Democrats, Mrs. Clinton has gone on the attack and tried to energize supporters.

headline.main: Hillary Clinton Races to Close Enthusiasm Gap With Bernie Sanders in Iowa
headline.print_headline: Rising Zeal by Fans of Sanders Puts Clinton on Attack in Iowa

snippet: With voters mobbing Mr. Sanders at events in the state, exposing a disparity in passion for the two Democrats, Mrs. Clinton has gone on the attack and tried to energize supporters.
